text: In July and August 2010 there were many heatwaves that affected Europe. In multiple countries all-time heat records were broken, including Finland, Russia and the Ukraine. Russia was most affected by the heatwaves, where the highest temperature during these heatwaves was measured, on 12 July 2010 in Utta. http://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/cdo-web/search?datasetid=GHCND https://www.metoffice.gov.uk/weather/learn-about/weather/case-studies/russian- heatwave ==Highest temperatures measured per country== Country Temperature Location Date 14 July Innsbruck 10 July Kleine-Brogel 16 July Knin 11 July Allinge-Sandvig 7 August Narva 29 July Liperi 26 August Mont-de-Marsan 10 July Bendorf 10 July Luxembourg Airport 9 July Arcen 12 July Utta 27 August Murcia 11 July Link√∂ping 14 July Basel 12 August Luhansk 9 July Gravesend ==References== Category:2010 in Europe Category:Climate change
title: 2010 European Heatwaves
